intro: Polygala moquiniana, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and pine flatwoods. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually narrow, giving it its common name. The flowers are usually pink or white and have a unique, spurred structure that distinguishes it from other species in the genus.
